alert.note: Alert for Luce (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 20 at 11:29AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 2 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...far northeastern Luce County in Upper Michigan. * WHEN...Until 200 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1123 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated light to moderate rainfall continuing as the strongest thunderstorms move out of the advisory area. Rapid river rises will cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 3.5 and 4.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.1 to 0.25 inches are expected over the area in the next hour. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Betsy Lake and Crisp Point. - www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
